intro: Trimezia spathata subsp. sincorana, commonly known as the slender spathed trimezia, is a member of the Agavaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are typically narrow and grass-like. The plant produces inflorescences of white to pale blue flowers, which are clustered in terminal spikes. It is native to Mexico and is often found in rocky or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed in horticulture.
